verses.verse: (1 To think on God in youth, and not to defer till age.7 The soul returneth to God.11 Wisdom is the gift of God, and consisteth in fearing him and keeping his commandments.) Remember now thy Creator in the days of thy youth, while the evil days come not, nor the years approach, wherein thou shalt say, I have no pleasure in them:

While the sun is not dark, nor the light, nor the moon, nor the stars, nor the (Before thou come to a continual misery: for when the clouds remain after the rain, manâ€™s grief is increased.) clouds return after the rain.

When the (The hands, which keep the body.) keepers of the house shall tremble, and the (The legs.) strong men shall bow themselves, and the (The teeth.) grinders shall cease, because they are few, and they wax dark that (The eyes.) look out by the windows:

And the (The lips, or mouth.) doors shall be shut without by the base sound of the (When the jaws, shall scarce open, and not be able to chew anymore.) grinding, and he shall rise up at the voice of the (He shall not be able to sleep.) bird: and all the (That is, the wind pipes, or the ears shall be deaf and not able to hear singing.) daughters of singing shall be abased:

Also they shall be afraid of the (To climb high because of their weakness, or they stoop down, as though they were afraid, lest anything should hit them.) high thing, and fear shall be in the (They shall tremble as they go, as though they were afraid.) way, and the almond tree shall (Their head shall be as white as the blossoms of an almond tree.) flourish, and the (They shall be able to bear nothing.) grasshopper shall be a burden, and concupiscence shall be driven away: for man goeth to the house of his age, and the mourners go about in the street.

While the (Meaning, the marrow of the backbone and the sinews.) silver cord is not lengthened, nor the golden (The little skin that covereth the brain, which is in color like gold.) ewer broken, nor the (That is, the veins.) pitcher broken at the (Meaning, the liver.) well, nor the (Which is the head.) wheel broken at the (That is, the heart, out of which the head draweth the powers of life.) cistern,
And dust return to the earth as it was, and the (The soul incontinently goeth either to joy or torment, and sleepeth not as the wicked imagine.) spirit return to God that gave it.
Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, all is vanity.
And the more wise the Preacher was, the more he taught the people knowledge, and caused them to hear, and searched forth, and prepared many parables.
The Preacher sought to find out pleasant words, and an upright writing, even the words of truth.

The words of the wise are like goads, and like nails (Which are well applied by the ministers, whom he calleth masters.) fastened by the masters of the assemblies, which are given by one (That is, by God.) pastor.

And of other things beside these, my son, take thou heed: for there is none end in making many (These things cannot be comprehended in books or learned by study, but God must instruct thine heart that thou mayest only know that wisdom is the true felicity, and the way thereunto is to fear God.) books, and much reading is a weariness of the flesh.
Let us hear the end of all: fear God and keep his commandments: for this is the whole duty of man.
For God will bring every work unto judgment, with every secret thing, whether it be good or evil.
